name: Boutique Hotel Stadthalle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here and were very happy. The location is very handy for the train station and the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. The breakfast is a great way to start the day with a large selection. The rooms are cosy warm and quiet a good size. Seems pricey but maybe that is just Vienna.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast, beautiful facilities, close to the center but not in the city center however with an underground station close by. 100% eco hotel. Great courtyard. Not an easy lighting system in the rooms.
reviews.title: Great breakfast, beautiful facilities, close to the center but not in the city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an enjoyable and relaxing stay at the Stadthalle hotel in late November 2011 and would definitely recommend this for those who are looking for an affordable and mid-range priced hotel that is accessible to and from the city center.
reviews.title: Environmentally-friendly, modern, clean and easily accessible hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros: The Stadthalle has a friendly and helpful staff. The staffer who helped with check-in also provided us with a map of the city and helped us with directions. Check in and check out were efficient with no hassles. The hotel provides a hearty and delicious breakfast buffet with plenty of cold and hot food options (as well as sufficient options for vegetarians). Our room (double room) was very spacious with a comfortable full-sized bed. The room was warm, inviting and cozy with the proper heating needed as Vienna gets very cold in this time of year. The room was always kept clean with daily housekeeping and fresh towels at your request. Everything in the hotel room worked. It had a modern shower and toilet which some guests might find to be on the small side but remember you are not going to spend all your time there in the duration of your stay. The hotel offered free wi-fi/internet access in the rooms which worked well most of the time (ask for a password/access code at reception). I appreciated the hotel management's environmental consciousness reflected in the way the rooms and common areas are designed. The rooms also really had a nice hint of lavender scent.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: While this hotel is not located in the city center itself, it is very close and accessible by public transportation (i.e. trams, trains). The U-bahn lines at Schweglerstrasse and Westbanhof stations are within a ten minute walk to and from the hotel. Door-to-door travel from the hotel to the city center at Stephansplatz by U-bahn is about 20-30 minutes. It is a great base for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Everything About It

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel has a bit of character and is perfectly comfortable. It is located approximately 5-10 minutes from the OBB part of Westbahnhof station (and probably 10+ min from the metro part) down what appears to be an otherwise quiet street. As a result it does take a little time to reach the main tourist centres.
reviews.title: Charming, quirky and efficient - and aspiring to constantly improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The interior design is crisp and clean cut with a focus on some quite cool artwork on some walls. In the room I stayed in the bed was very comfortable and well presented with an apple artfully in a dish next to the bed, although the interior of the bathroom was a little dark and slightly dated (but still in very good condition and very clean). There is free wifi. The buffet breakfast is also more than acceptable.
reviews.title: Some great perks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was generally very good although occasionally a little terse as the reception staff often seemed stretched for numbers. It is nice to see its focus on being eco-friendly as well.
reviews.title: Innovative hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I would certainly return. It does seem to be a hotel which is constantly aspiring to be better and that in itself is admirable. I am sure that, as time goes on, this hotel will move from good to excellent.
reviews.title: An Eco Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This eco-friendly hotel has some awesome perks - my favourite being the elderberry water they have at the ground floor, and the organic breakfast on offer - yum.
reviews.title: cosy, comfy and green hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel . The sustainable concept, the staff, the breakfast and even the location were quite marvelous. Close to the railwaystation we only had a short distance to the center and Schönbrunn castle. The garden was beautiful and the room to the garden was excellent. We had one of these rooms with the bath cabin - for us it was perfect, that the toilet was septerated. We will recommend the hotel to everybody and CERTAINLY COME BACK
reviews.title: what else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Love the sustainable concept and appreciate the extra discount since we arrived by train. The hotel has a nice breakfast and the staff are very nice, very responsive too with every one of my emails. There are two computers for guests' use in the lobby. The hotel is a short 10+ minutes walk from the West train station which was convenient as we came from Budapest that morning. This station also has a 7-euro bus (one way) that takes you to the airport which is much more convenient than the transfer via the S-bahn/U-bahn.
reviews.title: Great Concept but Small Bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only part that bothers me is the size of the bathroom. As you see in some of the photos posted by others, the shower/sink side is separate from the toilet compartment. The toilet is tiny and offer little privacy, with a spotlight on top of you and a translucent door, hmmm... you know what I mean. Although the shower is small (reminds me of being on a cruise ship) that doesn't bother me too much, I only care about water temperature, water pressure, and good draining.
reviews.title: Like it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: We like to walk, especially in the evening after a big meal, so we walked from the City Center via Mariahilferstrasse back to the hotel both evenings. It takes a while but it's nice. It would have been more convenient if the hotel on Mariahilferstrasse but then that will probably costs more too. Stadthalle is located in a residential neighborhood, it blends in somewhat on the front side (no big signage) but they created something pretty nice behind the facade. Oh, and I like how everything smells like lavender in this hotel.
reviews.title: Quiet, clean and modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Wow; great design room.
reviews.title: A clean, new, and quiet hotel with indifferent employees and a tricky location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: All the reviews are correct. Staff are very friendly even before arriving they had good communication with me as I had a parcel sent to them to wait for me and they kept me informed of it's arrival. When I arrived they were very welcoming and helpful.
reviews.title: Personal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was perfect for my needs as I was going to a concert in the area. Room was just the right size for me and I thought the curtained off bathroom was cute! Clean, comfortable and quiet! Free wifi was a bonus (I think every hotel should have it these days).
reviews.title: Great hotel for New Year city break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I missed breakfast as I had an early flight out to Frankfurt and the staff packed me a bag of fruit and sandwiches! A nice touch!
reviews.title: Good concept, but poor customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a lovely stay at the Boutiquehotel Stadthalle for 4 nights over New Year. The hotel is extremely hard to fault. It is welcoming with very comfortable and spacious modern rooms (the bathroom facilities are a little intimate, fine for couples but more privacy would probably be preferred with friends sharing). The environmental twist on the hotel is refreshing with ecofriendly touches throughout. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful with plenty of organic options following the ecofriendly theme.The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from one of the main train/underground stations making the city really accessible and easy to explore. There are a few restaurants within walking distance of the hotel if you dont want to always venture into the city centre. There is a small supermarket opposite which is very handy for the odd refreshments that you need. This is the perfect base for a relaxing stay in a wonderful city, the New Years celebrations in Vienna are fantastic and definately recommended for both friends, couples and families. We would definately revisit the Boutiquehotel Stadthalle on a return visit to Vienna. Note, the hotel does advertise a 10% discount on the total room rate for those travelling by train, however this only applies to people who would normally drive and not if you have flown in and travelled from the airport by train, this could be explained better. Overall a great little hotel.
reviews.title: Just perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it was a bit pricey, my friend and I booked this hotel partly because the website read "10% discount if you arrive by bicycle or train." We flew to Vienna, but assumed that meant if you actually ARRIVED at their premises by one of those modes of transport they gave the discount. So we took a train from the airport to the hotel.
reviews.title: to go again

description: A trendsetting combination of sustainability, design, and a touch of luxury: the world’s first hotel with a net zero energy balance is located in the heart of Vienna.
